privacy_seo_description: Learn about how Stocknear protects your privacy and handles your data. Our comprehensive privacy policy outlines our commitment to data security and transparency.
privacy_intro: Stocknear (the "website" or "site") is committed to protecting your privacy. This Privacy Policy explains the types of information we collect from you, how we use it, and the circumstances under which it may be shared. Please review this policy in its entirety along with our {termsLink}. Generally, you may use our website without providing personal data. When personal data (such as your name, address, or email address) is collected, it is done voluntarily. We will not share this data with third parties without your explicit consent. Please note that data transmission over the Internet (for example, via email) is not completely secure, and absolute protection against unauthorized access is not possible. The use of contact information provided in the imprint for sending unsolicited advertising or promotional material is strictly prohibited, and we reserve the right to pursue legal action in the event of such misuse.
privacy_cookies_intro: Our website utilizes cookies to enhance your browsing experience. We categorize cookies into three types:
privacy_cookies_necessary_desc: Essential for website functionality, including authentication, security, and remembering your preferences. These cannot be disabled.
privacy_cookies_analytics_desc: Help us understand how visitors interact with our website to improve user experience.
privacy_cookies_marketing_desc: Used to track visitors across websites for personalized advertising (Meta Pixel, Google Ads).
privacy_cookies_manage: You can manage your cookie preferences at any time. Click the button below to update your settings:
privacy_links_content: Our Service may include links to third-party websites that are not under our control. When you click on a third-party link, you will be directed to their site. We strongly encourage you to review the Privacy Policies of any website you visit. We assume no responsibility for the content, privacy practices, or policies of these external sites.
privacy_security_content: We prioritize the security of your data; however, please be aware that no method of Internet transmission or electronic storage is entirely secure. While we employ commercially reasonable measures to safeguard your Personal Data, we cannot guarantee its absolute security.
privacy_gdpr_title: Your Data Protection Rights Under General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR)
privacy_gdpr_intro: If you reside in the European Union (EU) or the European Economic Area (EEA), you have specific data protection rights under the GDPR. We strive to enable you to review, correct, update, or delete your Personal Data as needed.
privacy_gdpr_contact: If you would like to know what Personal Data we hold about you or wish to have it removed from our systems, please contact us at {email}.
privacy_gdpr_rights_intro: In addition, you have the following rights:
privacy_gdpr_right_1: The right to access, update, or delete the information we have on you;
privacy_gdpr_right_2: The right to rectification – to have inaccurate or incomplete information corrected;
privacy_gdpr_right_3: The right to object to our processing of your Personal Data;
privacy_gdpr_right_4: The right to request a restriction on the processing of your Personal Data;
privacy_gdpr_right_5: The right to data portability – to receive your Personal Data in a structured, machine-readable format;
privacy_gdpr_right_6: The right to withdraw consent at any time when processing is based on your consent.
privacy_gdpr_verify: We may require you to verify your identity before processing your request. Please note that providing certain essential information may be necessary to continue providing our Service.
privacy_gdpr_complaint: You also have the right to lodge a complaint with a Data Protection Authority regarding our handling of your Personal Data. For further details, please contact the relevant authority in your region.
privacy_caloppa_title: Your Data Protection Rights under the California Privacy Protection Act (CalOPPA)
privacy_caloppa_intro: CalOPPA is the first state law in the United States requiring commercial websites and online services to post a privacy policy. This law applies to any entity collecting personally identifiable information from California residents and mandates clear disclosure of what information is collected, how it is shared, and adherence to the policy.
privacy_caloppa_compliance: In accordance with CalOPPA, we commit to the following:
privacy_caloppa_1: Users can visit our site anonymously;
privacy_caloppa_2: Our Privacy Policy link, clearly labeled with the word "Privacy," is easily accessible at the bottom of our website;
privacy_caloppa_3: Users will be informed of any changes to our Privacy Policy via the dedicated Privacy Policy page;
privacy_caloppa_4: Users may update their personal information by contacting us at {email}.
privacy_caloppa_dnt: Additionally, we honor Do Not Track signals. When a Do Not Track setting is enabled in your web browser, we do not track, plant cookies, or use advertising technologies.
privacy_children_content: Our Services are not intended for children under the age of 18. We do not knowingly collect personally identifiable information from individuals under 18. If you become aware that a child has provided us with Personal Data, please contact us immediately. If it is determined that Personal Data from a child has been collected without parental consent, we will take steps to remove that information from our servers.
privacy_changes_content: We reserve the right to modify this Privacy Policy at any time. Any changes will be communicated by posting the updated policy on this page. We recommend that you review this Privacy Policy regularly to stay informed of any updates. Changes become effective immediately upon posting.
